footnotes.text:
1Edward O. Smith wrote and signed this letter.  The date of this letter is uncertain.
                  Lincoln received numerous letters in the winter of 1848-49 supporting Benjamin Bond
                  for the position of marshal; this letter, if written in January 1848, would have been
                  the first of its kind while Lincoln was serving in theHouse of Representatives.

2Bond received the appointment and held the job until 1853.  In March 1849, Lincoln
                  wrote several letters soliciting government officials on Bond’s behalf, though he

structured_content.text: Edward O. Smith to Abraham Lincoln, 16 [January] 18481

Efforts are making to confur or obtain the office of marshall of this state for several Gent[Gentlemen]–I would just say to you from my personal knowledge thatBenj Bondis the Chois of A very large majority of theWhigsassembled in and About Springfield, & You would confur A favour on A Great number of your friends if you would [lend?] your in fluence to help MrBond to that office2
